solution_line_template: On Tuesday, she brings in {muffins_monday} + {increase_per_day} = <<{muffins_monday}+{increase_per_day}={muffins_tuesday}>>{muffins_tuesday} muffins.
On Wednesday, she brings in {muffins_tuesday} + {increase_per_day} = <<{muffins_tuesday}+{increase_per_day}={muffins_wednesday}>>{muffins_wednesday} muffins.
On Thursday, she brings in {muffins_wednesday} + {increase_per_day} = <<{muffins_wednesday}+{increase_per_day}={muffins_thursday}>>{muffins_thursday} muffins.
On Friday, she brings in {muffins_thursday} + {increase_per_day} = <<{muffins_thursday}+{increase_per_day}={muffins_friday}>>{muffins_friday} muffins.

In total, she brought {muffins_monday} + {muffins_tuesday} + {muffins_wednesday} +{muffins_thursday} + {muffins_friday} = <<{muffins_monday}+{muffins_tuesday}+{muffins_wednesday}+{muffins_thursday}+{muffins_friday}={total_muffins_brought}>>{total_muffins_brought} muffins to school to share with her friends.
She baked a total of {total_muffins_brought} + {muffins_left_saturday} = <<{total_muffins_brought}+{muffins_left_saturday}={total_baked}>>{total_baked} muffins.
